title: Editor Frame Rate Limiter
description: Limits the editor's frame rate to the desired value based on whether play-in-editor is active or not.
longDescription:
This simple editor plugin allows you to cap the editor's frame rate to the desired value.


The plugin adds a new entry to the Editor Preferences page called "Editor Frame Rate Limiter", under the Plugins section. Here you can set the values that the plugin will use to limit the editor frame rate. The default value for editor-use is 40 fps, while the default for play-in-editor is -1 (use game default).


When you initially start the editor, or end/pause a play-in-editor session, the "Max Editor FPS" config entry value will be applied as the frame limit. When you begin play from within the editor, the "Max PIE FPS" config entry value will be applied. If one of these have a value of < 0, the plugin will, for that mode, use the value that the t.maxfps CVar was last set to by something other than this plugin, effectively retaining the original engine behavior.
technicalDetails:
Documentation


Features:

  • Applies an optional frame rate limit on editor start
  • Editor Preferences entry for easy configuration
  • Separate frame rate limit values for editor use and play-in-editor modes
  • If no limit is set for a specific mode (a value of -1 in the settings), reverts back to the engine's last used FPS limit (e.g. scalability settings)


Code Modules:

  • Â EditorFrameRateLimiter (Editor Module)


Number of Blueprints: 0

Number of C++ Classes: 2

Supported Development Platforms: Any

Important/Additional Notes:


The plugin uses the t.maxfps console command to manage the FPS limit. To avoid subscribing to console command sinks, the limit is only imposed on editor start and PIE start/stop/pause/resume. As such, using the t.maxfps command at runtime can override the current plugin-imposed fps limit, if any, until one of these events are triggered.
